FacilityName: Buckeye Pipe Line Company, L.P. - Toledo Station

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Pipeline Transportation of Refined Petroleum Products

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Buckeye Pipe Line Company, L.P. - Toledo Station was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association Code #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the Facility's policy to follow the most current future editions to the extent feasible and adhere to all applicable Federal, State, and Local codes/laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Facility's policy to contact the r and the Lucas County Emergency Management Agency, as appropriate, through the 911 Service. Medical emergencies will require notification of Oregon Ohio Fire and Rescue. The primary hospital response is provided through St. Charles Hospital (St. Vincent Hospital is the nearest Trauma Center).



Buckeye Pipe Line Company, L.P. - Toledo Station is a refined product storage and distribution Facility, including the butane blending system (direct injection into the gasoline truck rack lines). The Risk Management Plan covers the butane blending system including two horizontal storage vessels and associated receipt and transfer equipment and piping.



Buckeye Pipe Line Company, L.P. - Toledo Station complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D- Program Level 3). Additionally, this plan meets the requirements of the U.S. Department of Labor- Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Process Safety Management regulations (inclusive of all 14 elements) for Highly Hazardous Chemicals (29 CFR Part 1910.119).



This Facility has never had an accident or incident involving the butane blending system resulting in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering-in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Toledo Station butane blending system, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Oregon Ohio Fire and Rescue and request their assistance. The Facility's Emergency Response Action Plan is coordinated with Oregon Ohio Fire and Rescue and

the Lucas County LEPC. Oregon Ohio Fire and Rescue is aware of the Facility's butane blending system, its safety systems, access points, and protective procedures in the event of a significant release.  The Toledo Station maintains a vegetation control plan to minimize plant growth within 10 feet of the butane vessels.  The Facility is fully secured with fencing and controlled access in accordance with its site security plan.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety. Also, Buckeye makes every effort to coordinate annually at minimum with the local responders.
